channel.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
channel.description:
Will-o-Wisp is way too weak, not useful, and is a limited ability, which doesn't make much sense for one of three core Investigative BD classes.
I propose either one of the following changes to make Will-o-Wisp more useful and effective, yet still a niche for the Princess. All Investigative Abilities will continue to not be able to target the King.
Matchmake: (N) (2) Compare two players and see if they are of the same faction.
Will-o-Wisp: (N) (2) Compare two players and see if their class types are the same.
To make it fair for Cult Leader and Mastermind however, Mastermind's In The Shadows Passive should make Mastermind appear as an Investigative class. Prince should also be changed from a Blue Dragon Killer to a Blue Dragon Special, which makes sense overall for the Prince in my opinion.
And the most important thing to note is that this change would not make the Princess more confirmable than she is right now.

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
But it does fit thematically with Princess, at least the second ability

Read full topic

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
More like an inverted maid. And even then ToL doesn’t have a maid to compare it to.

Read full topic

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: techwolves
item.description:
This is basically a buffered version of maid

Read full topic

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Matchmake: (N) (2)
Compare two players and see if they are of the same faction.

Will-o-Wisp: (N) (2)
Compare two players and see if their class types are the same.

I like the second one. The first one I don’t like because using it with an outed Prince makes it almost as strong an Observer’s peek.

Read full topic

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

For example the “Check if target player is target class” ability I pitched for sheriff could work here too even without the “non-BD only” limitation.

That could work, but I’d still prefer it if it sheriff was given it instead of(or as a rework of) surveillance. The current surveillance is a bit niche and is better than expert investigations in every way.

Htm:

Tbh it does but I have a feeling princess’s will tend to out K/O classes more often which may lead to NKs/Invoker/Unseen K/O to die more often

More BD killer classes should be added then.

Read full topic

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: Htm
item.description:
Livicus:

Prince should also be changed from a Blue Dragon Killer to a Blue Dragon Special, which makes sense overall for the Prince in my opinion.

Tbh it does but I have a feeling princess’s will tend to out K/O classes more often which may lead to NKs/Invoker/Unseen K/O to die more often

Read full topic

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: ShadowKnight
item.description:
It helps differentiate the class type by comparing it with the action type. Flirt groups Support and Social, for example, who are not going to yield the same results when it comes t aggressive/defensive/neutral. The only Flirt result that this new Will O Wisp doesnt clarify is Killer/Offensive.

Read full topic

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
That feels just like Flirt

Read full topic

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: ShadowKnight
item.description:
Maybe the new Will O Wisp can have more charges (4/5) and informs if the target performs an aggressive, defensive or neutral action (attacks, conversion, occupation, swapping and the like are aggressive, protecting (yourself and others), healing and barriering are defensive, other actions are neutral).

This helps the Princess differentiate between Support and Social, as well as Special and Investigative, though not necessarilty between Killer and Offensive (since both are typically aggressive).

Read full topic

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp

item.description:
For example the “Check if target player is target class” ability I pitched for sheriff could work here too even without the “non-BD only” limitation.

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp

item.description:

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Not always. Most killing abilities give the same message. Same with occupation and healers. The new ability would be more for finding what classes are in the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
RHCube:

Gossip would be for finding what abilities affect your target, this would be for finding what classes visit your target.

The problem is that ability’s are class specific so if you know what ability the player used then 9 times out of 10 you know what class they are.

Read full topic

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
It could be given to observer instead.

NuclearBurrito:

The main issue against it is it’s similarity to gossip.

They’re similar in the way that Expert Investigations/Test Faith and flirt are similar. Gossip would be for finding what abilities affect your target, this would be for finding what classes visit your target.

Read full topic

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
RHCube:

Maybe it could determine what classes visit the target?

I did consider that however making it that would make it TOO good for confirming people ect.

The main issue against it is it’s similarity to gossip.

Read full topic

item.title: Change to Will-o-Wisp
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
I like the idea, but it’s still a bit niche(3 was visited by a killer! 3 died!). Maybe it could determine what classes visit the target? Though it would still be better if it was given to Observer instead.

Firelitten1:

Add it into follow

Lol. It could work as a window peek replacement.

Read full topic
